channel.title: Home on Blog de DD
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Blog de DD

item.title: Escher's Sphere
item.description: Introduction Figure 1: Escher’s Sphere Escher created three dimensional spaces that never existed with mathematical precision. He also was very good at conveying a sense of depth on a flat surface. All without the aid of a computer. About this sphere (made in 1958) he wrote: “Curved ribbons or strips are suited to suggest a three dimensionality… A system of four theoretically never ending ribbons running over the surface of the sphere linking at the poles.

item.title: Morphing between posiitive and Negative
item.description: This notebook shows how to use some of the tools in the package aPhotoDeDD.^[current location is (https://github.com/dashdotdotdashdotdot/aPhotoDeDD)] As this is an R Notebook, you can read the .html version on a browser or you can bring up the .Rmd version in Rstudio and run it line by line and make changes as desired. The animation that this program produces is posted on the instagram site of @dashdotdotdashdot: instagram. The idea is to run it once at a low resolution first with a small number of frames to see that it works before committing to creating a relatively large .

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.

item.title: Blog de DD
item.description: This is a blog to organize and keep track of my work in one place. I started it on December 13, 2022. Below are some external links to some of my work. Instagram: @dashdotdotdashdotdot My piece in the Bridges 2021 Mathematical Art Gallery: Escher’s Sphere Bridges 2021 Conference My paper in the Bridges 2022 Mathematical Art Conference (Bridges Aalto 2022): Spiral Based Point Cloud Representations of Sculptures Bridges Aalto 2022 Conference
